sentences.en: " Do you suppose I could get more up at the Broadway? "
sentences.cn: “ 你认为我去百老汇剧院能多挣一些 吗 ? ”

sentences.en: " Well, I am connected with the Wellington -- the new hotel on Broadway.
sentences.cn: “ 哦, 我在威灵 顿 饭店工作,那是百老汇大街上的一家新旅馆.

sentences.en: As we got close to Broadway, we heard the sounds of revelry getting louder and louder.
sentences.cn: 我们接近百老汇时，听到人们饮酒狂欢的声音越来越大。

sentences.en: Broadway was full of loafing thespians in search of next season's engagements.
sentences.cn: 百老汇大街上挤满了闲荡的演员,在寻找下个季度的演出机会.

sentences.en: Going out, the same Broadway taught her a sharper lesson.
sentences.cn: 从剧院里出来后, 还是这条百老汇大街给她上了更为深刻的一课.

sentences.en: He first appeared on Broadway last year.
sentences.cn: 去年他初次在百老汇登台演出.

sentences.en: He is walled in by a mountain of papers in his cluttered Broadway office.
sentences.cn: 在他凌乱的百老汇办公室里，他被堆成山的文件团团包围。

sentences.en: He produced "A Chorus Line", Broadway's longest running show.
sentences.cn: 他制作推出了《歌舞线上》这一百老汇经久不衰的剧目。

sentences.en: He's quite a character around New York -- a denizen of Broadway. "
sentences.cn: 他在纽约是个人物 —— 百老汇的地头蛇. ”

sentences.en: His last play bombed on Broadway.
sentences.cn: 他最近在百老汇演出的那场戏失败了.

sentences.en: In 1901, he broke out of vaudeville and set his sights on Broadway.
sentences.cn: 1901年，他放弃了杂耍表演，决定到百老汇发展。

sentences.en: In 1929 she shot to stardom on Broadway in a Noel Coward play.
sentences.cn: 1929年，她因出演诺埃尔·科沃德的一部剧而在百老汇一炮走红。

sentences.en: She shot to stardom on Broadway in a Noel Coward play.
sentences.cn: 她因在百老汇出演了一部诺埃尔·科沃德的戏一炮而红。

sentences.en: The next time he's in town I might take him out to dinner and a broadway show.
sentences.cn: 下次他再到这个城市来的时候，我可能得请他吃晚饭和到百老汇去看演出。

sentences.en: The play opened on Broadway in 2004.
sentences.cn: 这个剧在2004年于百老汇首演。

sentences.en: The show was an overnight success on Broadway.
sentences.cn: 在百老汇的演出一炮打响.
